alert.note: Alert for Northeast Highlands; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued June 15 at 1:20PM MDT until June 16 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT THROUGH 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EAST-CENTRAL NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...RED FLAG WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ACROSS SOUTHWESTERN, WEST CENTRAL, CENTRAL, AND PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN NEW MEXICO DUE TO VERY LOW HUMIDITY, STRONG WINDS AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Hot, dry and unstable conditions will prevail across the area through at least Saturday, with gusty westerly winds during the afternoon and evening bringing several hours of critical fire weather conditions to much of north central and west central New Mexico. Any fires that develop over the next few days will have the potential for significant growth in receptive fuel beds. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM TO 8 PM MDT FRIDAY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Red Flag Warning...which is in effect from 1 PM to 8 PM MDT Friday. A Fire Weather Watch has also been issued. This Fire Weather Watch is in effect from Saturday afternoon through Saturday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Mountains (Zone 105), West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109), Northeast Highlands (Zone 123) both Friday and Saturday afternoons through evenings. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West and southwest at 20 to 25 mph with occasional gusts to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...Minimum values of 7 to 12 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Highlands; West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
